intro: Allium loscosii, commonly known as the Loscosii garlic, is a perennial bulbous plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Caucasus and Central Asia. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its dense, clustered bulbs and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces tall, slender stems that bear umbels of white or pale purple flowers, which bloom in late summer. Its botanical features make it a hardy species adapted to cold and arid environments. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and culinary potential.
